timeline.bodyText:
@vbabenkoru
Do you think we should include this only when backend is ready? and everything is tested?
timeline.author: Ayyanchira
timeline.diffHunk:

 #### Fixed
 - nothing yet
 
+
+## [3.2.5](https://github.com/Iterable/iterable-android-sdk/releases/tag/3.2.5)
+#### Added
+- Introducing authToken. `setUserId` and `setEmail` methods now takes optional `authToken` parameter

replies.bodyText: We should make the methods private and ship 3.2.5 without this note. Once everything is ready for JWT, make them public again, ship 3.2.6 and add a link to the JWT docs in the changelog.
replies.author: vbabenkoru

replies.bodyText: @vbabenkoru  Should I make those methods private in this PR? OR should I have it seperate and rebase this one?
replies.author: Ayyanchira

replies.bodyText: I think ideally a separate PR, but here is also ok.
replies.author: vbabenkoru

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - `app_name` is set to `IterableAPI` in strings resource file
          
          
            
            - `app_name` was removed from published strings and replaced with plain string values in test manifests.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - Fixed an issue where trackInAppClicks were not being registered after displaying an inApp.
          
          
            
            - Fixed an issue where in-app click events were not being registered after displaying an in-app message.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - Fixed crash issues by handling null cases caused in `IterableInAppFragmentHTMLNotification` class
          
          
            
            - Fixed NullPointerExceptions in `IterableInAppFragmentHTMLNotification` that could occur in some cases when the activity is destroyed and recreated.

timeline.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: Victor Babenko <victor@iterable.com>

Keeping the two methods private

Planned to make it public when we launch the feature across backend and iOS together

Removing authToken changeLog

Also making updateEmail method private
